author: ETA PRIME
description:
What happens when you take a low-cost Dell OptiPlex office PC, toss in two cheap GPUs, and use a little-known app called Lossless Scaling to generate extra frames?
Well… it turns out this thing actually works. 😳 In this video, I’m upgrading a budget Dell OptiPlex 7070 with an RTX 3050 and Radeon RX 6400 to create a dual GPU Frankenstein PC — no special PSU, no extra cables. Just pure ingenuity and some Windows tweaks. We’ll set up Lossless Scaling for frame generation, run real in-game benchmarks like Cyberpunk 2077, Spider-Man 2, and Borderlands 4, and see if this weird combo can really double or even triple performance on a tiny power supply.
Is this the ultimate budget gaming trick — or the dumbest idea I’ve ever had? Let’s find out.

Get Lossless scaling here:

title: Dual GPU Budget PC Build | Huge FPS Boost!
